Examples

using Filtration
using Plots

Benyahia et al. Model

In the [Benyahia et al., 2013] model, functions $f_1$ and $f_2$ are given by

\[f_1(m) = \frac{b}{e+m}, \quad f_2(m) = am, \quad g(m) = \frac{1}{e+m}, \]

where $a$, $b$ and $e$ are positive numbers.

a = 1; b = 1; e = 1; t0 = 0; tf = 10

f₁(m) = b ./ (e .+ m)
f₂(m) = a .* m
g(m) = 1 ./ (e .+ m)

model = MembraneFiltrationModel(f₁, f₂, g)
optimal_synthesis(model, t0, tf)

Cogan-Chellamb model

The following functions have been proposed in [Cogan and Chellamb, 2014] and [Cogan and al., 2016]

\[f_1(m) = \frac{b}{e+m}, \quad f_2(m) = \frac{am}{e+m}, \quad g(m) = \frac{1}{e+m}\]

where $a$, $b$ and $e$ are positive numbers.

a = 1; b = 1; e = 1; t0 = 0; tf = 40

f₁(m) = b ./ (e .+ m)
f₂(m) = (a .* m) ./ (e .+ m)
g(m) = 1 ./ (e .+ m)

model = MembraneFiltrationModel(f₁, f₂, g)
optimal_synthesis(model, t0, tf)
